name: Colette
description: Colette was a Parisian concept store known for its carefully curated selection of fashion, beauty, and lifestyle products. Founded by Colette Rousseaux and her daughter Sarah Andelman in 1997, the store quickly became a cultural landmark and was recognized for its avant-garde approach to retail. Colette was particularly famous for its unique fragrance offerings, collaborating with niche perfume houses and providing exclusive scents that catered to sophisticated and discerning customers. The store not only sold products but also fostered an environment of artistic expression and innovation. Colette closed its doors in December 2017, leaving behind a significant legacy in the perfume and fashion industries.
address: 213 Rue Saint-Honor√©, 75001 Paris, France

name: Colgate-Palmolive

Established in 1806, the company has a rich history, originally starting with soap and candle production. Over the years, Colgate-Palmolive evolved into a leading provider of health and hygiene products, focusing on sustainability and innovation in both their manufacturing processes and product development.
